alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 9:26AM MDT until April 09 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM UNTIL 9 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK, EXCEPT FROM 11 AM UNTIL 9 PM MDT FROM THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD, DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM UNTIL 8 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOW PACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west and southwest winds will combine with several hours of single digit minimum humidities, well above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions this afternoon. Ridgetop winds will strengthen tonight and combine with poor humidity recoveries to produce locally critical fire weather conditions through the overnight hours. Consequently, critical conditions are expected to develop rapidly Sunday morning in many areas. Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions are forecast to persist areawide through Monday, then through Tuesday east of the central mountain chain. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM MDT this evening. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 9 AM to 8 PM MDT Sunday. In addition...a Fire Weather Watch has been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Below snowpack this afternoon until mid evening with locally critical conditions persisting through tonight. Critical conditions rapidly increase in coverage Sunday morning, then persist through early evening for all areas below snowpack. The potential exists for critical conditions to return to all areas below snowpack Monday afternoon until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 afternoon. Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph over ridgetops tonight and Sunday. Then, southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 5 to 15 percent today, then 9 to 15 percent Sunday and Monday. Poor humidity recoveries tonight south of a line from Red River to El Vado Lake. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
